Malawi is implementing scale-up plans for achieving the 90-90-90 goals including test and start. The country continues to employ innovative service delivery methods that include decentralization, integration of services and task shifting. Malawi’s lack of critical health facility infrastructure poses an increasing barrier to expansion of service delivery, necessitating expansion and improvement in physical space if program goals are to be achieved. ART facilities, pharmacy distribution points and HIV commodity storage space were identified as priority construction projects to support current needs. ART facilities and commodity stores will be built at various scales, depending on existing infrastructure, anticipated volume of patients, and residual need. Pharmacy distribution points may be built at current health facilities or in communities to enhance retention, improve access to HIV drugs and streamline refills for stable patients.
